summary: The Maps & Geocoding plugin integrates Google Maps for address geocoding, church location display, and family mapping across ChurchCRM.

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content:
1. Obtain a Google Maps API Key from https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/get-api-key
2. Enable the 'Geocoding API' product for your key in the Google Cloud Console.
3. Enter the key in the Google Maps API Key field and click 'Test Connection'.
4. A successful test will geocode your church address and store the coordinates automatically.

sections.title: Church Lat/Long
sections.content: The Church Latitude and Church Longitude fields store the resolved coordinates for your church address. These are used to center the map on all map pages. You can let the plugin populate them automatically via the Test Connection button, or enter them manually.

sections.title: Hide Lat/Lon Fields
sections.content: Enable 'Hide Lat/Lon Fields in Family Editor' to remove the Latitude and Longitude input boxes from the Family Editor form. Address-based geocoding lookups still run in the background â€” only the visible input fields are hidden.

sections.title: Fallback Behaviour
sections.content: If no API key is stored in the plugin, ChurchCRM falls back to the legacy 'sGoogleMapsGeocodeKey' system setting. Similarly, church coordinates fall back to 'iChurchLatitude' / 'iChurchLongitude', and the hide-fields flag falls back to 'bHideLatLon'.
